edu.osu.cse.mmxi.machine.interpreter.instructions
Interface Instruction

All Known Implementing Classes:
Instruction.ADD, Instruction.ADDimm, Instruction.AND, Instruction.ANDimm, Instruction.BRx, Instruction.DBUG, Instruction.JSR, Instruction.JSRR, Instruction.LD, Instruction.LDI, Instruction.LDR, Instruction.LEA, Instruction.NOT, Instruction.RET, Instruction.ST, Instruction.STI, Instruction.STR, Instruction.TRAP
public interface Instruction

Nested Class Summary
static class Instruction.ADD
          Adds two registers and writes to a third.
static class Instruction.ADDimm
          Adds a register to an immediate operand and writes to another register.
static class Instruction.AND
          Takes the bitwise AND of two registers and writes to a third.
static class Instruction.ANDimm
          Takes the bitwise AND of a register with an immediate operand and writes to another register.
static class Instruction.BRx
          Conditionally branches to a given immediate address on the current page, depending on the condition codes.
static class Instruction.DBUG
          The debug command takes no arguments (its instruction format is 1000xxxxxxxxxxxx, with x = don't care), and it just prints out the contents of the 8 registers, the PC, and the FLAGS register.
static class Instruction.JSR
          The JMP/JSR command performs an unconditional branch to the given page offset in the current page.
static class Instruction.JSRR
          The JMPR/JSRR command performs an unconditional branch to an address, given as the value of a given register plus an unsigned 6-bit index.
static class Instruction.LD
          The LD command loads the value of memory at a given page offset into a register.
static class Instruction.LDI
          The LDI command retrieves the value of memory at a given page offset, interpreted as an address, and loads the value at this address into a register.
static class Instruction.LDR
          The LDR command loads the value of memory at an address calculated as a base register value plus a 6-bit unsigned immediate index into a destination register.
static class Instruction.LEA
          The LEA command calculates an address given a page offset and the page number of the PC, and stores it in a register.
static class Instruction.NOT
          Sets the destination register to the bitwise-NOT of the source register.
static class Instruction.RET
          The RET instruction, designed for use with JSR/JSRR (see Instruction.JSR), sets the PC to the contents of register 7.
static class Instruction.ST
          The ST command stores a register to memory at a given page offset.
static class Instruction.STI
          The STI command retrieves the value of memory at a given page offset, interpreted as an address, and stores the source register to this address.
static class Instruction.STR
          The STR command stores a source register to memory at an address calculated as a base register value plus a 6-bit unsigned immediate index.
static class Instruction.TRAP
          The TRAP instruction allows the programmer to call the OS for access to I/O functionality.
 
Method Summary
 boolean execute(Machine m)
          Executes an instruction on the Machine.
 

Method Detail

execute

boolean execute(Machine m)
Executes an instruction on the Machine.

Parameters:
m - The machine upon which to execute the instruction.
Returns:
true if the executed instruction modified a general purpose register.
